alert.note: Alert for Albany; Columbia; Greene; Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 1:04PM EST until February 19 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Albany County in east central New York... Northeastern Greene County in east central New York... Southwestern Rensselaer County in east central New York... * Until 200 PM EST. * At 103 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Center Brunswick to near Berne, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 24. Interstate 87 between exits 21B and 2. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 7. Locations impacted include... Albany, Troy, East Greenbush, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Chatham, Nassau, Delmar, Guilderland, Menands, New Baltimore, Ravena, Stephentown, Coxsackie, Voorheesville, Green Island, Grafton, Valatie and Castleton-On-Hudson. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
